Information: Scalar used to modify energy demands--used to represent efficiency improvements in energy demands in different industries.
Fraction of point-of-use demand from coal.
Fraction of point-of-use demand from coke.
Fraction of point-of-use demand from diesel.
Fraction of point-of-use demand from electricity.

Variable: Industrial Energy Fuel Fraction Furnace Gas
Information: Fraction of point-of-use demand from furnace gas.
Fraction of point-of-use demand from gasoline.

Variable: Industrial Energy Fuel Fraction Hydrocarbon Gas Liquids
Information: Fraction of point-of-use demand from hydrocarbon gas liquids, including propane, butane, and ethane.
Fraction of point-of-use demand from hydrogen.
Fraction of point-of-use demand from kerosene.

Variable: Industrial Energy Fuel Fraction Natural Gas
Information: Fraction of point-of-use demand from natural gas.
Fraction of point-of-use demand from oil.
Fraction of point-of-use demand from solar.

Variable: Industrial Energy Fuel Fraction Solid Biomass
Information: Fraction of point-of-use demand from solid biomass.

Variable: Initial Energy Consumption in Agriculture and Livestock
Information:
| Total energy demand at time :math:`t = 0` for on-farm agricultural production, including off-road vehicles (such as tractors, combines, etc.) and other stationary agricultural equipment that may or not be electrical powered. Excludes residential demands and off-farm transportation (e.g., private vehicles and freight transport).
 | 
 | Initial energy consumption is combined with aggregated production in agriculture and livestock to estimate an average intensity at time 0.
 | 
 | Demands are passed to the industrial energy model, where emissions from different fuel uses are calculated. Efficiencies in technological use by fuel are assumed to respond to industrial averages.
 | 
 | Energy demands are assumed to grow proportionally with total tonnage of production. Process efficiencies--e.g., requiring less point-of-use energy to perform a task (different from efficiencies in fuel-use technologies)--can be implemented using the Demand Scalar.

Variable: Initial Energy Consumption Intensity of GDP
Information: Initial energy consumption per gdp by each industrial category $CAT-INDUSTRY$ that is driven by gdp. Represents the energy required for industrial production rather than energy consumed at time 0 (should account for inefficiencies).

Variable: Initial Energy Consumption Intensity of Production
Information: Initial energy consumption per tonne of production by each industrial category $CAT-INDUSTRY$ that is driven by production. Represents the energy required for industrial production rather than energy required

Variable: Electrical Energy Consumption from Industrial Energy
Total Electrical Energy Consumption from Industrial Energy
Total Energy Consumption from Industrial Energy
